channel.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less

item.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:18, topic:350887”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=447240.msg3290762#msg3290762 date=1280544362]

Been using some kind of tunneling for ages cause I could use free usenet servers

Such as?
[/quote]http://go6.net for tunneling and the servers were news.ipv6.eweka.nl newszilla6.xs4all.nl and reader.ipv6.xsnews.nl but they dont work anymore. :([/quote]

I’ve got a tunnel from hurricane electric (thanks to mopman’s link), I was just curious about the free ipv6 usenet servers you were talking about.

Read full topic
item.source: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less

item.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:350887”]I just contacted my ISP today asking them if they have a plan about ipv6, surprisingly they knew what I was talking about but said they have no plans regarding it, and that the idea may be scrapped nationwide (never heard that one before…). They also have no plans for when the ipv4 addresses run out. I just hope I don’t lose my public, static IP…[/quote]I actually just called mine the 3 different times I called none of the tech support employees knew what I was talking about so I asked if I could talk to someone like the supervisor but they neglected to allow me. So really I could report them as they need to allow me to talk to him.

Read full topic

item.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

nope, they get allocated blocks. they pay an administration fee, but that just covers the cost of someone processing your application. the addresses still arent yours, you cant resell them and they can be taken back.

Read full topic

item.source: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less

item.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I just contacted my ISP today asking them if they have a plan about ipv6, surprisingly they knew what I was talking about but said they have no plans regarding it, and that the idea may be scrapped nationwide (never heard that one before…). They also have no plans for when the ipv4 addresses run out. I just hope I don’t lose my public, static IP…

Read full topic
item.source: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less

item.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There was an article on an Australian tech site a couple of months ago saying the same thing. Old news, but surprisingly enough ISPs are slow on the IPv6 uptake.

Read full topic
item.source: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less

item.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:350887”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=447240.msg3283881#msg3283881 date=1280074667]
They have been saying this for forever now. I’ve been dying to enable ipv6 on this web server for a long time now, but crappy SMF still doesn’t have any ipv6 support at all, so there would be no way to track or ban users. One day I just might be forced to hack it in myself.
[/quote]What exactly would you need to change in SMF? I thought you’d just have to allow the storage of bigger IP’s, and change a bit of validation and tracking code.[/quote]

That’s it, in a nutshell. It’s a little more complicated than that, but I could do it, I’ll probably end up doing it.

Read full topic

item.title: IPv4 addresses to run out in 12 months or less
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:350887”]Funny, they said this a few years ago

IPv6 to the home will be a while coming to most, especially in the UK and US.

http://ipv6.he.net/ <- free tunnel&exhaustion stats[/quote]
They said it will run out soon, now they are giving a time limit.

Is there any advantages for the user with the change to IPv6?

Read full topic
